snippet: Forward Amar’e Stoudemire won’t play in Game 3 of the Knicks’ playoff series with the Heat, but he said he hoped to play in Game 4 on Sunday in New York.
abstract: New York Knicks forward Amar'e Stoudemire contends that his self-inflicted hand injury is a case of bad timing; he will not play in Game 3 of playoff series against the Miami Heat. (M)
lead_paragraph: GREENBURGH, N.Y. -- To Amar'e Stoudemire it was all an accident, a momentary swipe of his left hand in the frustrating wake of a dispiriting defeat. In his words, he meant to ''make some noise,'' not summon paramedics and several days of censure. As his Knicks teammates practiced Wednesday, Stoudemire contended that Monday night's self-inflicted hand injury -- caused when he broke the glass partly enclosing a fire extinguisher -- was a case of bad timing. It was an unfortunate mishap, with blood and screaming headlines to follow.
